title: Distributing the Negative Sign
text: Because the second part of the expression is being subtracted, we can distribute the negative sign into that part. $$-(6-i)=-6+i$$. The expression is now $$\left(-5+3i\right)+\left(-6+i\right)$$.
speech: Because the second part of the expression is being subtracted, we can distribute the negative sign into that part.  minus, parentheses 6 minus i,  is equal to negative 6 plus i . The expression is now  parentheses, negative 5 plus 3 i  plus, parentheses, negative 6 plus i,  .

title: Associative Property
text: The next step is to group the like terms. We can use the Associative Property to rewrite this expression as $$\left(-5+\left(-6\right)\right)+3i+i$$.
speech: The next step is to group the like terms. We can use the Associative Property to rewrite this expression as  parentheses, negative 5 plus negative 6,  plus 3 i plus i .
pacedSpeech: The next step is to group the like terms. We can use the Associative Property to rewrite this expression as   , negative 5 plus negative 6,  plus 3 i plus i

title: Combining Like Terms
text: Now, we can add numbers in the parentheses to combine like terms.
speech: Now, we can add numbers in the parentheses to combine like terms.
pacedSpeech: Now, we can add numbers in the parentheses to combine like terms.

title: Standard Form
text: Finally, we can write the expression in $$a+bi$$ form: $$-11+4i$$.
speech: Finally, we can write the expression in  a plus, b i  form:  negative 11 plus 4 i .
pacedSpeech: Finally, we can write the expression in   a plus, b i
